title: Neural Dynamics and Active Inference
description: Understanding how neural systems implement Active Inference through dynamical equations and population coding.
learning_objectives: Understand neural implementation of Active Inference
Apply neural dynamics to brain function

content.overview: Neural dynamics provides the bridge between Active Inference theory and neural implementation. It describes how populations of neurons implement belief updating, prediction, and control through dynamical equations.

population_coding.dynamical_systems: Neural dynamics as gradient flow on free energy

synaptic_dynamics.hebbian_learning: Neurons that fire together wire together
synaptic_dynamics.three_factor_rule: Eligibility traces, prediction errors, and neuromodulation

mathematical_formulation.belief_dynamics: dμ/dt = -D(μ) ∇_μ F(μ, x) where D(μ) is precision matrix
mathematical_formulation.precision_dynamics: dπ/dt = β (γ - π) where γ is expected precision

neural_implementation.oscillatory_dynamics: Gamma oscillations emerge from prediction errors

mathematical_model.precision_modulation: D_i = σ^{-2}(ε_i) precision as inverse variance
mathematical_model.oscillatory_behavior: Gamma oscillations emerge from error dynamics

mathematical_model.forward_model: x_t = f(s_t, a_t) + ε_t sensory prediction
mathematical_model.inverse_model: a_t = g^{-1}(x_t, s_t) motor command computation

computational_examples.name: Neural Mass Model Simulation
computational_examples.description: Simulating neural population dynamics using differential equations
implementation_steps: Set up differential equations for membrane potentials

mathematical_model.firing_rates: r_i = φ(V_i) sigmoid or ReLU activation

computational_examples.active_inference_connection: Population activity represents beliefs, synaptic weights encode generative model

computational_examples.name: Predictive Coding Neural Network
computational_examples.description: Implementing hierarchical predictive coding in neural networks
computational_examples.architecture: Deep network with lateral and feedback connections
computational_examples.evaluation_metrics: Reconstruction quality, prediction accuracy, representational hierarchy

computational_examples.name: Spike-Timing Dependent Plasticity
computational_examples.description: Modeling synaptic learning rules in Active Inference
implementation_steps: Implement spiking neuron model (LIF or HH)
Compute prediction errors from population activity
Update synaptic weights using three-factor rule

mathematical_formulation.three_factor_rule: dw/dt = η ε(t) e(t-Δt) where ε is prediction error

computational_examples.neural_interpretation: Synaptic changes encode causal relationships learned through prediction errors

connections_to_active_inference.action: Motor commands minimize expected free energy

steps: Implement neural mass equations in Python
Simulate hierarchical network with multiple populations
Add sensory input and analyze response dynamics
Compute prediction errors and precision updates
interactive_exercises.tools: NumPy/SciPy for ODEs, Matplotlib for visualization
interactive_exercises.validation: Compare simulated dynamics with experimental data

steps: Implement spiking neuron model (e.g., leaky integrate-and-fire)
Add synaptic connections with STDP learning rule
Present stimulus patterns and observe learning
Analyze synaptic weight changes over time
interactive_exercises.mathematical_focus: Three-factor learning rule with eligibility traces

interactive_exercises.description: Build and train a predictive coding neural network
steps: Implement prediction error computation between layers

interactive_exercises.description: Model the effects of neuromodulators on neural dynamics
interactive_exercises.biological_relevance: Connect to experimental studies of attention and learning

neural_criticality.description: Neural systems operate near critical phase transitions
neural_criticality.experimental_evidence: fMRI, EEG, and local field potential studies

neural_oscillations.gamma_oscillations: 40 Hz oscillations linked to prediction errors
neural_oscillations.theta_oscillations: 4-8 Hz oscillations in memory and navigation

neural_plasticity_mechanisms.neuromodulatory_control: Modulation of plasticity by brain state

common_misconceptions.clarification: Neural activity approximates beliefs through population coding
Active Inference operates at subconscious levels
Stochastic elements are essential for Bayesian computation

common_misconceptions.misconception: Neural networks are just artificial neural networks
common_misconceptions.clarification: Biological neural dynamics include rich temporal and spatial structure
Most prediction error processing occurs subconsciously

further_reading.title: Predictive Coding in the Visual Cortex
further_reading.author: Rao and Ballard

metadata.author: Active Inference Community
metadata.enhancement_notes: Expanded with comprehensive mathematical formulations, computational examples, advanced topics, and practical implementations
